what-profit.context: Judah suggests selling Joseph instead of killing him
what-profit.hebrew: מַה־בֶּצַע כִּי נַהֲרֹג אֶת־אָחִינוּ וְכִסִּינוּ אֶת־דָּמוֹ
what-profit.english: What profit is it if we kill our brother and cover his blood?

sell-him.english: Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, and let not our hand be upon him

i-will-be-surety.english: I will be surety for him; from my hand you shall require him

sin-against-father.hebrew: אִם־לֹא הֲבִיאֹתִיו אֵלֶיךָ וְחָטָאתִי לְךָ כָּל־הַיָּמִים
sin-against-father.english: If I do not bring him back to you, I shall bear the blame before you forever

let-me-remain.context: Judah offers himself as slave instead of Benjamin
let-me-remain.hebrew: יֵשֶׁב־נָא עַבְדְּךָ תַּחַת הַנַּעַר עֶבֶד לַאדֹנִי
let-me-remain.english: Please let your servant remain instead of the boy as a servant to my lord

how-go-up.hebrew: כִּי אֵיךְ אֶעֱלֶה אֶל־אָבִי וְהַנַּעַר אֵינֶנּוּ אִתִּי
how-go-up.english: For how can I go up to my father if the boy is not with me?
how-go-up.mood: desperate love, cannot face Jacob's grief

lions-whelp.hebrew: גּוּר אַרְיֵה יְהוּדָה מִטֶּרֶף בְּנִי עָלִיתָ
lions-whelp.english: Judah is a lion's whelp; from the prey, my son, you have gone up

scepter-not-depart.context: The promise of kingship to Judah's line
scepter-not-depart.english: The scepter shall not depart from Judah

praised-by-brothers.english: Judah, your brothers shall praise you
